intro: Scorzonera intricata, commonly known as the alpine scorzonera, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces a tuberous root system that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Scorzonera intricata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in alpine ecosystems.
